title: Social Problem-Solving Projects Using Computer Simulations

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Learners (office/administrative professionals) engage in projects analyzing complex social phenomena with simulation tools and deriving solutions

learning_goals: Learners can identify core variables of social systems and formulate hypotheses by incrementally adjusting simulation complexity
Learners can interpret simulation results including counterintuitive variables to generate and design verification processes for at least three hypotheses
Learners can apply simulation analysis results to real-world social problem-solving through project-based collaborative reporting.

resources: Data analysis tools (Excel, Python standard libraries)
Case study compendium (population migration, economic disparities, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
